Articles.Content:
Do they actually improver jets performance? and are they stackable? (i.e can you have two before an engine and see twice the benefit?

thanks,

 - Sam

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-09T19:28:18Z" title="05/09/2015 07:28  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 9, 2015</time> by sam.johnson841**

They radiate heat better than almost any other part, which allows you to go a little faster without overheating (in the atmosphere), and they also serve as air intakes and jet fuel tanks, but they don't affect engine performance directly.

Thanks, im assuming as they don't directly affect jet performance that the effect wont stack?

 - Sam

They are good for pulling heat from engines to radiators (if you use wing clusters for nukes then a preecooler after nuke and with wings on it works very nicely), but aside from that minimal benefits, and they arent quite worth it in most situations. That said, if you ever need a engine nacelle, they look good, give you essentially free fuel (most of the time i use em its instead of a structural part suchg as the mk1 fuselage), and they have the bonus of being a intake, although thats only useful for some situations.
